Package frogger.navigation

Class NavController

java.lang.Object
frogger.navigation.NavController
public class NavController
extends java.lang.Object
The NavController is a controller class used for manipulating a JavaFX scene graph. The NavController cannot be directly instantiated and is instead provided by Navigation. The NavController is attached to only one scene, and stores references to all possible destinations (potential root nodes of the scene graph) in a HashMap. The NavController currently only supports destinations that are subclasses of World.
See Also:
Navigation, World

    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private javafx.scene.Scene scene
    A reference to the Scene that the controller is attached to.
    private java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Class<? extends World>,​World> worldHashMap
    A HashMap to store all current destinations (potential root nodes) associated with the current scene.

  • Field Details

    • worldHashMap

      private java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Class<? extends World>,​World> worldHashMap
      A HashMap to store all current destinations (potential root nodes) associated with the current scene.

    • scene

      private final javafx.scene.Scene scene
      A reference to the Scene that the controller is attached to.

  • Constructor Details

    • NavController

      protected NavController​(javafx.scene.Scene scene)
      Creates a NavController that can manipulate a scene graph and attach it to a Scene. Can only be called by the Navigation class. Creates an empty list of destinations stored in the controller.
      Parameters:
      scene - The Scene to which the controller should attach itself to.

  • Method Details

    • removeDestination

      public void removeDestination​(java.lang.Class<? extends World> cls)
      Removes a destination from the list of potential root nodes.
      Parameters:
      cls - The class of the destination to be removed.

    • navigateTo

      public void navigateTo​(java.lang.Class<? extends World> cls)
      Changes to root node of the scene graph to the desired node. The previous root node's stop() method is called and the new root node's World.start() method is called.
      Parameters:
      cls - The class of the destination to be navigated to.

    • addDestination

      public void addDestination​(java.lang.Class<? extends World> cls, World world)
      Adds a destination to the list of potential root nodes. This only adds the destination if it is not part of the current list of destinations.
      Parameters:
      cls - The class of the destination to be added.
      world - The instance of the destination to be added.

    • addDestination

      public void addDestination​(java.lang.Class<? extends World> cls)
      Adds a destination to the list of potential root nodes by calling the default constructor of the class passed in. This only adds the destination if it is not part of the current list of destinations.
      Parameters:
      cls - The class of the destination to be added.

    • addDestination

      public void addDestination​(World world)
      Adds a destination to the list of potential root nodes. This only adds the destination if it is not part of the current list of destinations.
      Parameters:
      world - The instance of World to added as a destination.

    • startCurrentDestination

      public void startCurrentDestination()
      Calls the World.start() method of the current destination (root node of scene graph)

    • stopCurrentDestination

      public void stopCurrentDestination()
      Calls the World.stop() method of the current destination (root node of scene graph)
